meanings.definition: To move or shift from the usual place or position.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind is displacing the leaves on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The worker is displacing the boxes to make space in the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat is displacing the toys all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The new road construction is displacing the traffic flow in the city.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake is displacing the rocks, creating a new landscape.

meanings.definition: To take the place of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The young actor is displacing the veteran star in the lead role.
meanings.sent2: The digital clock is displacing the old analog one on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The clever robot is displacing the need for manual labor in factories.
meanings.sent4: The modern technology is displacing traditional methods in many industries.
meanings.sent5: The new manager is displacing the old one, bringing fresh ideas to the team.

meanings.definition: To force someone or something to leave their home or usual environment.
meanings.sent1: The flood is displacing families from their homes along the river.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire is displacing wildlife from their natural habitats.
meanings.sent3: The noisy construction work is displacing the peace and quiet of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species is displacing native plants in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The war is displacing civilians, causing them to seek refuge in safer areas.
